summary: This document is an email chain from late 2020 to early 2021 among FBI Victim Services Division personnel and a therapist, discussing the approval process for providing therapy to a newly identified victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence reveals internal procedures and questions about victim verification, timing of counseling requests, and funding sources.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: A therapist who reached out to inform the FBI Victim Services Division that they will begin treating a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, seeking approval for the sessions.

events.title: Scheduled Therapy Session for Epstein Victim
events.description: A therapist informs the FBI Victim Services Division that they will begin seeing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein for treatment regarding her victimization.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was processing a request to approve and fund therapy for a newly identified victim of Jeffrey Epstein in late 2020.

Internal emails show FBI staff questioning why the victim was seeking counseling only at that time, her financial situation, and whether she had been interviewed or confirmed as a victim in the original investigation.
The correspondence references a 'victims fund that's now open' as a potential alternative funding source for counseling services.
A therapist based in Greenaeres, Florida, was scheduled to begin treatment sessions for the victim on December 8, 2020.
The document highlights the ongoing administrative and support processes for Epstein victims years after the initial investigations.
